provisions.title: Section 1
provisions.content:
1. This Order may be cited as the Parishes Water Supply (St.
Catherine) (Limits) Order, 1974.

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. The limits of the water supply district for the parish of St.
Catherine shall comprise the whole parish.

provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3. Every person in possession of property within the parish who
rerelves any weter supply or service from the Parish Council (here-
inafter referred to as the Council) shall pay to the Council in every
month at the head office of the Cou~lcilat Spanish Town. or at such
other places as the Council may from time to time specify, the rates
and charges specified in the Parishes Water Supply (St. Catherine)
(Rates and Charges), Order, 1974 :
  Provided that any person who has entered into a special contract
with the Council shall pay in accordance with the terms of that
contract.

provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4. Without prejudice to any other metlicd of enforcement, where a
consumer-
    (a) is in arrears with his payment; or
     (b) neglects or fails to make such payments,
for a period not less than one month. the Council may discontinue
the supply of water to such consumer: and the supply shall not be
returned until all such arrears, together with any further charges or fees
which may properly have accrued or become payable, have been paid:
               [The inclusion of this papa ia authorked by L.N. 67119821
  THE PARISHES WATER SUPPLY (ST. CATHERINE) BY-LAWS, 1974
  Provided that the discontinuance of the supply shall not prevent
the accrual of any further proper monthly charges or fees.

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5. The Council may from time to time install a meter in connection
with, and within, any premises in the parish, and the rates and charges
to be paid by the consumer shall be regulated according to the
quantity of water registered by and the size, of the meter.

provisions.title: Section 6
provisions.content:
6.-(1) Where a meter is found to be defective, the limits of in-
accuracy and the estimation of consumption shall be regulated as
follows-
    (a) where the quality of water registered by a meter at normal
         flow is not more than 5% above or below the actual quantity
         passed, the meter shall be deemed to be accurate;
    (b) where the meter ceases to register or is proved to register
        inaccurately the quantity of water passing through it, the
        Council may make a fair and reasonable estimate of the
        quantity of water supplied; and such estimate shall be based
        upon-
            (i) the registration of a substituted meter; or
           (ii) the average registraticn during the previous three
                months; or
           (iii) the average registration during the corresponding three
                 months of the previous year,
         whichever basis is considered equitable by the Council, having
         regard to all the circumstances of the case.
      (2) Where a consumer requests the removal and testing of a
meter, the consumer shall pay in advance to the Council the cost of
removing, carting and testing the meter in accordance with the following
scale of charges, namely-
    where the diameter of the inlet or outlet of the meter
      does not exceed half an inch ...         ...      ...                 $1.00
    exceeding half an inch and not exceeding one inch ...                   $1 S O
    exceeding one inch and not exceeding one and one-
      half inches           ...      ...       ...      ...                 $2.00
    exceeding one and one-half inches--such higher
        charge as the Council may deem reasonable.
              [The inclusion o f this payc is authorired by L.N. 67/19821
  THE PARISHES WATER SUPPLY (ST. CATHERINE) BY-LAWS, 1974
       (3) Where the meter is found to be inaccurate (by registering on
test at normal flows more than 5% above or below the correct
registration) the charge shall be refunded by the Council to the con-
sumer, and his account for water rates shall be adjusted in accordance
with the percentage of error.
